title: Retail Stocks: Apple, Nike, Walmart, Target Close Stores Amid Protests, Lootings
summary:
Target (TGT), Walmart (WMT), Nike (NKE) and Apple (AAPL) are among the retailers that closed stores and cut operating hours as curfews were imposed amid widespread looting connected to the George Floyd protests in cities across the country.
Retail Stocks Close StoresTarget temporarily closed 175 stores due to the ongoing protests.
The company said it has kept some of its stores closed.
Pharmacy customers at closed stores were being directed to other stores to get their prescriptions filled.

text:
Target (TGT), Walmart (WMT), Nike (NKE) and Apple (AAPL) are among the retailers that closed stores and cut operating hours as curfews were imposed amid widespread looting connected to the George Floyd protests in cities across the country. Retail stocks were mixed.

X

Protests erupted around the country over the death of unarmed black man George Floyd, who died as officers tried to take him into custody in Minneapolis. Derek Chauvin, who was filmed restraining him by kneeling on his neck for several minutes, has been charged with murder.

But looters have been raiding and smashing up stores. It is another blow for retailers, which are in the process of reopening following coronavirus shutdowns.

Retail Stocks Close Stores

Target temporarily closed 175 stores due to the ongoing protests. Some 71 stores are in Minnesota, with at least a dozen being shuttered in California and New York. The discounter has said it will pay workers affected by the closures for up to 14 days of scheduled hours. Employees are also being offered the chance to work at other nearby Target stores that remain open,

Dow Jones stock Walmart shuttered hundreds of stores across the country in an attempt to protect employees and customers. Several dozen stores were closed all day Sunday after being damaged by protesters. It is unclear when the stores will be able to reopen. A spokesman told CNBC that employees are "being taken care of."

Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.

Apple stores have been a high-profile victim of looters, with individuals smashing their way into stores and making off with stock in Minneapolis, Brooklyn and Washington. The company said it has kept some of its stores closed.

Meanwhile, Amazon (AMZN) cut operating hours and delivery for its Whole Foods chain. Stores near Los Angeles, Minneapolis and Chicago remained closed. It also stopped taking online orders at its Bryant Park store in New York City.

CVS Health (CVS) has also been targeted by looters. The drugstore chain has said it shuttered locations in more than 20 states and the District of Columbia. Pharmacy customers at closed stores were being directed to other stores to get their prescriptions filled.

Nike also closed some stores following raids, and said it is closely following the protests occurring across the country. Archrival Adidas (ADDYY) is temporarily closing all of its U.S. stores

Retail Stocks Mixed

Target stock fell 2.3% to 119.49 on the stock market today. It has formed a 23-week cup-with-handle base, MarketSmith analysis shows, It is trying to reach a buy point of 126.07. It has an IBD Composite Rating of 82 out of 99.

Walmart stock dipped 0.1%. It managed to find support at the 50-day line, which is a positive sign. It has a Composite Rating of 74.

Apple stock rose 1.2% to 321.85. AAPL stock finally closed above a 319.79 alternative entry. It has a strong Composite Rating of 91.

Amazon stock climbed 1.1%, not far from record highs. It has a near-perfect Composite Rating of 98.

CVS stock rose 0.1%. It inched up to just below its 200-day moving average.

Nike stock tilted 1% higher. It is closing in on a 105.72 buy point after building a 19-week cup base. It has a good Composite Rating of 90. Adidas stock was up 2.6%.

<article class="clearfix post-5882726 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news tag-apple-stock-news tag-retail-and-ecommerce-stocks-and-industry-news prim_stock_symbol-nke prim_stock_symbol-aapl prim_stock_symbol-tgt prim_stock_symbol-wmt prim_stock_symbol-amzn article_type-staffarticle distribution_rights-distribute">
<header>
<ul class="post-categories">
<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/news/" rel="category tag">News</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
These Retailers Shutter Stores As Lootings Mar George Floyd Protests	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/news/retail-stocks-apple-nike-walmart-target-stores-close-amid-protests-lootings/" data-a2a-title="These Retailers Shutter Stores As Lootings Mar George Floyd Protests"><a class="a2a_button_facebook" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/facebook?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fnews%2Fretail-stocks-apple-nike-walmart-target-stores-close-amid-protests-lootings%2F&linkname=These%20Retailers%20Shutter%20Stores%20As%20Lootings%20Mar%20George%20Floyd%20Protests" title="Facebook" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/facebook.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Facebook"></a><a class="a2a_button_twitter" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/twitter?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fnews%2Fretail-stocks-apple-nike-walmart-target-stores-close-amid-protests-lootings%2F&linkname=These%20Retailers%20Shutter%20Stores%20As%20Lootings%20Mar%20George%20Floyd%20Protests" title="Twitter" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/twitter.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Twitter"></a><a class="a2a_button_linkedin" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/linkedin?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fnews%2Fretail-stocks-apple-nike-walmart-target-stores-close-amid-protests-lootings%2F&linkname=These%20Retailers%20Shutter%20Stores%20As%20Lootings%20Mar%20George%20Floyd%20Protests" title="LinkedIn" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/linkedin.png" width="25" height="25" alt="LinkedIn"></a><a class="a2a_dd addtoany_share_save addtoany_share" href="https://www.addtoany.com/share"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/email.png" alt="Share"></a></div> <a class="reprints-button sharing" href="https://www.ibdlicensing.com" target="_blank">Licensing</a>
</div>
<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/larkinm/" title="Posts by MICHAEL LARKIN" class="author url fn" rel="author">MICHAEL LARKIN</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">04:05 PM ET 06/01/2020</li>
</ul>
</div>
</header>
<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p><strong>Target</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TGT' target='_blank'>TGT</a>), <strong>Walmart</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=WMT' target='_blank'>WMT</a>), <strong>Nike</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NKE' target='_blank'>NKE</a>) and <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) are among the retailers that closed stores and cut operating hours as curfews were imposed amid widespread looting connected to the George Floyd protests in cities across the country. Retail stocks were mixed.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5750190" vid-dom-id="5750190-5ed70bbe7594a" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/ZSMf2S8I.m3u8" data-captions="" vid-name="Find The Best Long-Term Investments With IBD Long-Term Leaders" vid-cat="Learn How To Trade Stocks Using Research Tools" vid-date="04/24/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/ZSMf2S8I-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="Matt Galgani">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5750190-5ed70bbe7594a" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Find The Best Long-Term Investments With IBD Long-Term Leaders","description":"Looking for stocks with solid earnings stablility and a proven track record of outperfomrance across multiple market cycles? Start with IBD Long-Term Leaders.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/04\/ZSMf2S8I-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/ZSMf2S8I.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-04-24T09:52:32+0000","duration":"PT69.59S","author":"Matt Galgani","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>Protests erupted around the country over the death of unarmed black man George Floyd, who died as officers tried to take him into custody in Minneapolis. Derek Chauvin, who was filmed restraining him by kneeling on his neck for several minutes, has been charged with murder.</p>
<p>But looters have been raiding and smashing up stores. It is another blow for retailers, which are in the process of reopening following coronavirus shutdowns.</p>
<h2>Retail Stocks Close Stores</h2>
<p>Target temporarily closed 175 stores due to the ongoing protests. Some 71 stores are in Minnesota, with at least a dozen being shuttered in California and New York. The discounter has said it will pay workers affected by the closures for up to 14 days of scheduled hours. Employees are also being offered the chance to work at other nearby Target stores that remain open,</p>
<p class="Component-root-0-2-60 Component-p-0-2-52">Dow Jones stock Walmart shuttered hundreds of stores across the country in an attempt to protect employees and customers. Several dozen stores were closed all day Sunday after being damaged by protesters. It is unclear when the stores will be able to reopen. A spokesman told <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/31/amazon-target-and-apple-scale-back-business-in-cities-hit-hard-by-protests.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">CNBC</a> that employees are "being taken care of."</p>
<hr />
<p style="padding-left: 30px;"><strong><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.</a></strong></p>
<hr />
<p>Apple stores have been a high-profile victim of looters, with individuals smashing their way into stores and making off with stock in Minneapolis, Brooklyn and Washington. The company said it has kept some of its stores closed.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, <strong>Amazon</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AMZN' target='_blank'>AMZN</a>) cut operating hours and delivery for its Whole Foods chain. Stores near Los Angeles, Minneapolis and Chicago remained closed. It also stopped taking online orders at its Bryant Park store in New York City.</p>
<p><strong>CVS Health</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=CVS' target='_blank'>CVS</a>) has also been targeted by looters. The drugstore chain has said it shuttered locations in more than 20 states and the District of Columbia. Pharmacy customers at closed stores were being directed to other stores to get their prescriptions filled.</p>
<p>Nike also closed some stores following raids, and said it is closely following the protests occurring across the country. Archrival <strong>Adidas</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=ADDYY' target='_blank'>ADDYY</a>) is temporarily closing all of its U.S. stores</p>
<h2>Retail Stocks Mixed</h2>
<p>Target stock fell 2.3% to 119.49 on the <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-market-today-market-trends-best-stocks-buy-watch/">stock market today</a>. It has formed a 23-week cup-with-handle base, <a href="https://marketsmith.investors.com/">MarketSmith analysis shows</a>, It is trying to reach a buy point of 126.07. It has an <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/the-ibd-composite-rating/">IBD Composite Rating of 82 out of 99.</a></p>
<p>Walmart stock dipped 0.1%. It managed to find support at the 50-day line, which is a positive sign. It has a Composite Rating of 74.</p>
<p>Apple stock rose 1.2% to 321.85. AAPL stock finally closed above a 319.79 alternative entry. It has a strong Composite Rating of 91.</p>
<p>Amazon stock climbed 1.1%, not far from record highs. It has a near-perfect Composite Rating of 98.</p>
<p>CVS stock rose 0.1%. It inched up to just below its 200-day moving average.</p>
<p>Nike stock tilted 1% higher. It is closing in on a 105.72 buy point after building a 19-week cup base. It has a good Composite Rating of 90. Adidas stock was up 2.6%.</p>
